data.title: Strings with ASCII alphabet characters
data.statement:
You will be given <<3 inputs>> :
 - an <<integer>> [[inputA]] corresponding to an <<ASCII code value>>
 - a <<string>> [[inputB]] containing the <<positions of the letter corresponding to the ASCII code of [[inputA]]>> in the expected result string.
 - an <<integer>> [[N]] corresponding to the <<length>> of the expected result string.

<<Goal>> : 
Create a <<string of length>> [[N]] which must be composed of :
- the <<letter corresponding to the ASCII code value>> of [[inputA]] at the position(s) indicated in [[inputB]].
- the character {{#}} for the <<remaining positions>>.

<<WARNING>> : <<Position 1>> refers to the <<first>> character of the string ! If the position given is 0, the specified letter does not appear at any position.

The positions and the number of times they appear in the string change for each test case.

Good luck and have fun ! ;)
data.stubGenerator:
read inputA:int
read inputB:string(256)
read N:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: [[inputA]] is an integer corresponding to an <<ASCII code value>>.
<<Line 2>>: [[inputB]] is a string containing the <<positions of the letter corresponding to the ASCII code of [[inputA]]>> in the expected result string. The positions in the string are comma-separated.
<<Line 3>>: [[N]] is an integer corresponding to the <<length>> of the expected result string.
data.outputDescription: A <<single string>> of length [[N]] composed by the character {{#}} <<and/or>> a <<letter>> at specific position(s).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You will be given 3 inputs :
- an integer inputA corresponding to an ASCII code value
- a string inputB containing the positions of the letter corresponding to the ASCII code of inputA in the expected result string.
- an integer N corresponding to the length of the expected result string.

Goal :
Create a string of length N which must be composed of :
- the letter corresponding to the ASCII code value of inputA at the position(s) indicated in inputB.
- the character # for the remaining positions.

WARNING : Position 1 refers to the first character of the string ! If the position given is 0, the specified letter does not appear at any position.

The positions and the number of times they appear in the string change for each test case.

Good luck and have fun ! ;)
Input
Line 1: inputA is an integer corresponding to an ASCII code value.
Line 2: inputB is a string containing the positions of the letter corresponding to the ASCII code of inputA in the expected result string. The positions in the string are comma-separated.
Line 3: N is an integer corresponding to the length of the expected result string.
Output
A single string of length N composed by the character # and/or a letter at specific position(s).
Constraints
64 < inputA < 133
0 < length of inputB < 257
0 < N < 15
Example
Input
65
2
8
Output
#A######
